subject: Re: [PATCH] bpf: use FS_USERNS_DELEGATABLE for bpffs

reviews.author: bot+bpf-ci
reviews.summary: The reviewer pointed out that FS_USERNS_DELEGATABLE is not defined anywhere in the kernel tree and will cause a build failure due to an undefined identifier.

reviews.author: Alexander Mikhalitsyn (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer raised no technical concerns, but pointed out unrelated test failure and clarified patch's behavior.

reviews.author: Daniel Borkmann
reviews.summary: Reviewer Daniel Borkmann suggested running additional tests before merging the patch, specifically through the BPF CI with the vfs branch and the patch on top.

reviews.author: Alexei Starovoitov
reviews.summary: Alexei Starovoitov suggested sending the patch via bpf-next after the merge window to ensure a full CI run and AI review, indicating he wants changes before approval.

reviews.author: Christian Brauner
reviews.summary: Reviewer Christian Brauner pointed out that using FS_USERNS_DELEGATABLE alone is insufficient for security, and suggested either modifying Jeff's patch to require CAP_SYS_ADMIN when this flag is set or keeping the permission check in bpf_fill_super().

reviews.author: Jeff Layton
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Jeff Layton, pointed out that the patch does not address the issue of mount_capable() failing without CAP_SYS_ADMIN capability.
